<Link id="l03061" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3061"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    n = 64&#42;m + j,   0 &lt;= j &lt; 64</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03068" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3068"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//    r = f&#42;(ln(2)/64) = x - n&#42;(ln(2)/64)</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l03255" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3255"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The regular method converting a 64-bit integer to float roughly consists of</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03256" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3256"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 2 steps: normalization and rounding. In fact, after normalization, the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03257" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3257"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conversion from a 64-bit integer to a float is essentially the same as the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03258" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3258"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// one from a 32-bit integer. The only difference is that it has more</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03259" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3259"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// trailing bits to be rounded. To leverage the native 32-bit conversion, a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03260" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3260"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// 64-bit integer could be preprocessed and fit into a 32-bit integer then</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3261"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// converted into the correct float number. The basic steps for the unsigned</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3262"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// conversion are illustrated in the following pseudo code:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3263"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3264"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// f32 uitofp(i64 u) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3265"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   i32 hi, lo = split(u);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3266"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   // Only count the leading zeros in hi as we have native support of the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3267"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   // conversion from i32 to f32. If hi is all 0s, the conversion is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3268"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   // reduced to a 32-bit one automatically.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3269"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   i32 shamt = clz(hi); // Return 32 if hi is all 0s.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3270"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   u &lt;&lt;= shamt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3271"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   hi, lo = split(u);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3272"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   hi |= (lo != 0) ? 1 : 0; // Adjust rounding bit in hi based on lo.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3273"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   // convert it as a 32-bit integer and scale the result back.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3274"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//   return uitofp(hi) &#42; 2^(32 - shamt);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3275"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3276"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3277"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// The signed one follows the same principle but uses &#39;ffbh&#95;i32&#39; to count its</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3278"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// sign bits instead. If &#39;ffbh&#95;i32&#39; is not available, its absolute value is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3279"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// converted instead followed by negation based its sign bit.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3280"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3281"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdloc">SDLoc</a> SL(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3282"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Src = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#ab471937b9a227e70c7fe8bd9604014d6">Op</a>.getOperand(0);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3283"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3284"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2bac1a5298f939e87e8f962a5edfc206918">Hi</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3285"><span class="doxyHighlight">  std::tie(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2baff50b4aa1c9cc2197ef898436641c911">Lo</a>, <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a9ac8e4e13ad96a39c3f8db9ed633ad2bac1a5298f939e87e8f962a5edfc206918">Hi</a>) = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/amdgputargetlowering/#aaf8d7f83f5f1ac927a1f43a8db7ce730">split64BitValue</a>(Src, DAG);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3286"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> Sign;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3287"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sdvalue">SDValue</a> ShAmt;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3288"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/nvptx/nvptxisellowering-cpp/#ae1a90b5d85643644483b2ca70da4d13faed3fa7a5efe80dad3ea3d86cc14be246">Signed</a> &amp;&amp; Subtarget-&gt;isGCN()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03289" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3289"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We also need to consider the sign bit in Lo if Hi has just sign bits,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03290" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3290"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// i.e. Hi is 0 or -1 However, that only needs to take the MSB into</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03291" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3291"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// account. That is, the maximal shift is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03292" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3292"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - 32 if Lo and Hi have opposite signs;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03293" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3293"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - 33 if Lo and Hi have the same sign.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03294" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3294"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03295" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3295"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Or, MaxShAmt = 33 + OppositeSign, where</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03296" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3296"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03297" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3297"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// OppositeSign is defined as ((Lo ^ Hi) &gt;&gt; 31), which is</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3298"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// - -1 if Lo and Hi have opposite signs; and</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3299"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// -  0 otherwise.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3300"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3301"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// All in all, ShAmt is calculated as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3302"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3303"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  umin(sffbh(Hi), 33 + (Lo^Hi)&gt;&gt;31) - 1</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03304" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3304"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3305"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// or</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03306" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3306"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l03307" /><CodeLine lineNumber="3307"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  umin(sffbh(Hi) - 1, 32 + (Lo^Hi)&gt;&gt;31).</span></CodeLine>
